name: Brown, Appellant, v. Carnegie-Illinois Steel Corp.

judges: Before Drew, C. J., Stern, Stearne, Jones, Bell, Ladner and Chidsey, JJ.
parties: Brown, Appellant, v. Carnegie-Illinois Steel Corp.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Curiam,
There is nothing that we can add to the able and comprehensive opinion of Hirt, J. of the learned Superior Court.
Judgment affirmed.
opinions.author: Pee Curiam,

attorneys: P. K. Motheral and Thomas Lewis Jones, with them Reed, Smith, Shaw & McClay, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Brown, Appellant, v. Carnegie-Illinois Steel Corp.
Argued May 25, 1951.
Before Drew, C. J., Stern, Stearne, Jones, Bell, Ladner and Chidsey, JJ.
June 27, 1951:
Samuel J. Goldstein, for appellant.
P. K. Motheral and Thomas Lewis Jones, with them Reed, Smith, Shaw & McClay, for appellees.
